senses.de: To make one thing compatible with another
senses.ex: He has struggled to reconcile his political beliefs with his religious beliefs.

Tips.title: Compatibility Effort
Tips.description: When you reconcile things like beliefs, you make them exist together without conflict.
Tips.example: She works hard to reconcile her career and family life.

Tips.title: Beyond Simple Fix
Tips.description: Reconciling often implies a deeper resolution, not just a quick or surface-level fix.
Tips.example: The CEO's challenge was to reconcile the company's values with its actions.

senses.de: To become friends again after a fight or disagreement
senses.ex: They had a big fight, but they were able to reconcile.

Tips.title: Personal Relationships
Tips.description: Use 'reconcile' for fixing personal relationships, highlighting a restored harmony.
Tips.example: After a heartfelt apology, they reconciled and rebuilt their friendship.

Tips.title: Positive Outcome
Tips.description: When people reconcile, it often carries a positive connotation of forgiveness and recovery.
Tips.example: The siblings reconciled after years of not speaking to each other.

senses.de: To make or prove consistent with
senses.ex: She was trying to reconcile her ledger

Tips.title: Financial Accuracy
Tips.description: In finance, 'reconcile' usually means making sure numbers tally in accounting.
Tips.example: The accountant reconciled the receipts with the bank statements meticulously.

Tips.title: Attention to Detail
Tips.description: Reconciling financial accounts requires care to avoid errors and ensures accuracy.
Tips.example: They spent the entire day reconciling the financial records for tax purposes.

senses.ex: He finally reconciled himself to the change in management.

Tips.title: Internal Acceptance
Tips.description: Reconciling oneself to something means coming to terms with it, accepting it internally.
Tips.example: He reconciled himself to his new role in the company.

Tips.title: Process of Adjustment
Tips.description: It's a process of internal adjustment, where one might gradually become more accepting of a situation.
Tips.example: After the relocation, she slowly reconciled herself to the vibrant city life.

Harmonize.wordDefinition:
Harmonize means to make things similar or compatible with each other. It is applicable when we want to bring two or more different things, ideas or actions together so that they work well and coexist.

For example, a musician harmonizes with other musicians in a band to create a beautiful melody by blending their different notes and sounds.

Patch up.wordDefinition:
The phrase patch up is used when repairing or fixing something broken or damaged. In terms of relationships, it suggests a temporary fix or a quick solution to a problem.

For example, two friends may patch up their disagreement but they may not necessarily address the root cause of the problem.

It suggests working through the issues and finding a resolution together. For example, a couple may go to therapy to reconcile after a major argument.

Patch up is a short-term fix while reconcile is a long-term solution in terms of repairing relationships.

Resolve.wordDefinition:
Reconcile means to resolve a conflict or disagreement between two or more parties and come to a mutually agreed-upon solution or understanding.

Resolve means to find a solution to a problem, challenge, or issue.

Reconcile is applicable in situations where there is conflict or disagreement, and the goal is to repair the relationship, while resolve is applicable in situations where there is a problem that needs to be solved, and the focus is on finding a solution.

Reunite.wordDefinition:
Reunite refers to getting back together after being separated, such as old friends or family members who have been apart for a long time.

Reconcile is applicable when there is a need for conflict resolution, while reunite is applicable when there is a desire to come back together after separation.

Settle.wordDefinition:
Settle means to resolve a problem or disagreement in a more final way. When something is settled, it is usually considered to be done and over with.

To simplify it, reconcile means to make peace with someone or something after a disagreement, whereas settle means to resolve a dispute or problem in a definite way.

Unite.wordDefinition:
To unite means to bring together different things or groups into one. It's applicable when there are different factions or groups that need to come together for a common purpose.

For example, a sports team must unite and work together to win a game.

In summary, reconciling is about repairing relationships, while uniting is about bringing things together for a common goal.
